meanings.definition: To break or fall apart into small fragments
meanings.sent1: The old cookie crumbles easily when touched.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the ancient ruins crumbles away.
meanings.sent3: The sandcastle crumbles as the waves wash over it.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence crumbles like a sandcastle in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The dry leaves crumbles underfoot as we walk through the forest.

meanings.sent1: The neglected building crumbles due to lack of maintenance.
meanings.sent2: His resolve crumbles when faced with temptation.
meanings.sent3: The cake crumbles under the weight of too much frosting.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship crumbles under the strain of misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The sand sculpture crumbles under the hot sun, losing its shape.

meanings.definition: Small fragments of something that has broken or crumbled
meanings.sent1: She swept up the crumbles of the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: The table was covered in the crumbles of a delicious pastry.
meanings.sent3: The crumbles of the cookie were eagerly picked up by the children.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were surrounded by the crumbles of fallen stones.
meanings.sent5: The crumbles of the sandcastle lay scattered on the beach.
